data.title: Guasch Social Stereotypes and Masculine Homosexualities PDF
data.meta_description: Guasch; Social stereotypes and masculine homosexualities.pdf - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document discusses the evolution of social stereotypes about male homosexuality in Spain from the Franco dictatorship to the present. It identifies three periods: pre-gay (Franco era), gay (transition to democracy), and hyper-gay (current). During pre-gay, the dominant stereotypes were "marica" (effeminate) and "maricon" (masculine active male). As democracy emerged, stereotypes shifted to focus on "gayness" instead of sexual roles. Both social views and self-perceptions of homosexuals changed. Now in the hyper-gay period, homosexuals have more autonomy in their public representations, challenging old stereotypes.
